summary: The Wildlife Confiscations Network Act of 2025 directs the Secretary of the Interior to establish a cooperative Wildlife Confiscations Network.  The network will assist federal wildlife law enforcement agencies by aiding in the placement and care of animals seized from illegal trade, building on a pilot program in Southern California. The bill defines key terms, outlines the network's functions and membership, establishes a committee to oversee the network, and authorizes appropriations of $5 million annually from 2026-2030 to support this effort.
